title: 820-00244 no video
message: I got a 820-00244.  it has .8v on cpu vcore but not getting any video on lcd or hdmi w/ apple oem adapter.

title: 820-00244 no video
message: Had a similar problem with an other MBP. The issue here was a faulty BIOS/SPI Flash IC. You can try to flash a known working BIOS binary.

title: 820-00244 no video
message:
Probably dead CPU, as all A1534 boards end in same way.

Did you test for USB activity at least?
Known good BIOS is worth to try.

title: 820-00244 no video
message:
I don't have a donor board for this guy.  am i replacing the bios chip or just flashing it?

customer just wants data at this point?  if bad cpu should i try to reflow it to get the data?

usb mouse: i get initial red flash, but nothing after that

title: 820-00244 no video
message:
You should test with USB macOS pendrive, with Link LED.
If LED flashes, there is 100% USB activity.
If not, no real reason to search for video; board doesn't really boot.

title: 820-00244 no video
message: I don't have any pen drives that have led lights, but i connected my owc ssd adapter and has a light.

title: 820-00244 no video
message: Power LED doesn't confirm USB activity...

title: 820-00244 no video
message: light is flasing with ssd inisde

title: 820-00244 no video
message: I hope Link LED is flashing, not the Power LED of external SSD adapter.
